text: I seems that this request has been around for a very long time and doesn't feel that complex  any ideas why its still not here

it would be nice if there is a HUBL variable to detect if its in a page editor or global group editor ( i know request.domain can be use to do this but i think it would be handy to have it? ) :slightly_smiling_face:

Hey Danica, would you be able to post this to the ideas forum and then also provide a use case for it. I can see the value in being able to show some information from the in-app editor experience but also not sure if using the help text or inline help text fields might be able to help in your situation
Idea: Emmet in the Design Manager
What about an electron version of the dm.
PS, I’m mostly joking, but I thought it had been too long since this had been brought up
Ah ye old Emmet discussion. I do remember these discussions in years past.
brackets > atom > vs code > HubSpot dm. the next evolution of the electron code editor

It’s always weird getting called out by your past self. Cracks me up though.

For now - good news is you can use emmet in your local code editor of choice.

Right now it’s not a high priority, since if you want emmet, you can already use it locally.

We’re currently setting our eyes on bigger more impactful changes right now.

We’re certainly listening for feedback. If folks want this: I’d recommend starting an idea forum post, linking to it from here. The upvotes give us a way of tracking true demand for it.
<@U7SL518D6>,you get this shipped and I'll buy you a beer at emmet's

Go to your design manager in a chrome based browser.

Click the 3 dot menu > More Tools > Create shortcut.

Enable open as window.

heh, fair.

I would argue though installing the app as a PWA/shortcut is actually more useful though. You can have your extensions - your login credentials etc all automatically work. No updates needed over time either since the underlying code will just update with chrome.
